00032 #if _WIN32
00033 #include <windows.h>
00034 #define __inline__ __inline
00035 #define snprintf _snprintf
00036 typedef unsigned __int64 QWORD;         // for MSVC
00037 typedef signed   __int8  SBYTE;
00038 typedef signed   __int16 SWORD;
00039 typedef signed   __int32 SDWORD;
00040 typedef signed   __int64 SQWORD;
00041 #else
00042 #if defined __sun
00043 #define BYTE_ORDER 1234
00044 #define BIG_ENDIAN 1234
00045 #define LITTLE_ENDIAN 4321
00046 #define u_int8_t uint8_t
00047 #define u_int16_t uint16_t
00048 #define u_int32_t uint32_t
00049 #define u_int64_t uint64_t

00063 // Define endianess
00064 
00065 #ifndef __X86__
00066 // These should catch x86 with most compilers
00067 #if defined _X86_ || defined _i386_ || defined __i386__
00068 #define __X86__
00069 #endif
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 #ifndef __LITTLE_ENDIAN__
00073 // These should catch little-endian with most compilers
00074 #if (BYTE_ORDER == LITTLE_ENDIAN) || defined __X86__ || defined _ALPHA_
00075 #define __LITTLE_ENDIAN__
00076 #endif
00077 #endif

00080 // Registers
00081 #define REGISTER_EAX 0
00082 #define REGISTER_ECX 1
00083 #define REGISTER_EDX 2
00084 #define REGISTER_EBX 3
00085 #define REGISTER_ESP 4
00086 #define REGISTER_EBP 5
00087 #define REGISTER_ESI 6
00088 #define REGISTER_EDI 7
00089 #define REGISTER_NOP 8  // no register defined

00091 // Registers

00104 #define REG_DL REG_EDX
00105 #define REG_SS REG_EDX
00106 #define REG_ST2 REG_EDX

00132 // Implied operands
00133 #define IOP_EAX         1
00134 #define IOP_ECX         (1 << REG_ECX)
00135 #define IOP_EDX         (1 << REG_EDX)
00136 #define IOP_EBX         (1 << REG_EBX)
00137 #define IOP_ESP         (1 << REG_ESP)
00138 #define IOP_EBP         (1 << REG_EBP)
00139 #define IOP_ESI         (1 << REG_ESI)
00140 #define IOP_EDI         (1 << REG_EDI)
00141 #define IOP_ALL         IOP_EAX|IOP_ECX|IOP_EDX|IOP_ESP|IOP_EBP|IOP_ESI|IOP_EDI
00142 #define IS_IOP_REG(x,y) (x >> y) & 1
00143 #define IS_IOP_EAX(x)   (x) & 1
00144 #define IS_IOP_ECX(x)   (x >> REG_ECX) & 1
00145 #define IS_IOP_EDX(x)   (x >> REG_EDX) & 1
00146 #define IS_IOP_EBX(x)   (x >> REG_EBX) & 1
00147 #define IS_IOP_EBP(x)   (x >> REG_EBP) & 1
00148 #define IS_IOP_ESI(x)   (x >> REG_ESI) & 1
00149 #define IS_IOP_EDI(x)   (x >> REG_EDI) & 1

00174 // Process eflags
00175 #define EFL_CF         (1 <<  0)
00176 #define EFL_PF         (1 <<  2)
00177 #define EFL_AF         (1 <<  4)
00178 #define EFL_ZF         (1 <<  6)
00179 #define EFL_SF         (1 <<  7)
00180 #define EFL_TF         (1 <<  8)
00181 #define EFL_IF         (1 <<  9)
00182 #define EFL_DF         (1 << 10)
00183 #define EFL_OF         (1 << 11)
00184 #define EFL_MATH       EFL_OF|EFL_SF|EFL_ZF|EFL_AF|EFL_PF|EFL_CF
00185 #define EFL_BITWISE    EFL_OF|EFL_CF|EFL_SF|EFL_ZF|EFL_PF
00186 #define EFL_ALL_COMMON EFL_CF|EFL_OF|EFL_SF|EFL_ZF|EFL_AF|EFL_PF

00305 // Operand types
00306 enum Operand {
00307         OPERAND_TYPE_NONE,      // operand not present
00308         OPERAND_TYPE_MEMORY,    // memory operand ([eax], [0], etc.)
00309         OPERAND_TYPE_REGISTER,  // register operand (eax, mm0, etc.)
00310         OPERAND_TYPE_IMMEDIATE, // immediate operand (0x1234)
00311 };
00312 
00313 // Structure definitions
00314 
00315 // struct INST is used internally by the library
00316 typedef struct _INST {
00317         DWORD type;             // Instruction type and flags
00318         const char *mnemonic;   // Instruction mnemonic
00319         int flags1;             // First operand flags (if any)
00320         int flags2;             // Second operand flags (if any)
00321         int flags3;             // Additional operand flags (if any)
00322         int modrm;              // Is MODRM byte present?
00323         short eflags_affected;  // Processor eflags affected
00324         short eflags_used;      // Processor eflags used by this instruction
00325         int iop_written;        // mask of affected implied registers (written)
00326         int iop_read;           // mask of affected implied registers (read)
00327 } INST, *PINST;
00328 
00329 // Operands for the instruction
00330 typedef struct _OPERAND {
00331         enum Operand type;      // Operand type (register, memory, etc)
00332         int reg;                // Register (if any)
00333         int basereg;            // Base register (if any)
00334         int indexreg;           // Index register (if any)
00335         int scale;              // Scale (if any)
00336         int dispbytes;          // Displacement bytes (0 = no displacement)
00337         int dispoffset;         // Displacement value offset
00338         int immbytes;           // Immediate bytes (0 = no immediate)
00339         int immoffset;          // Immediate value offset
00340         int sectionbytes;       // Section prefix bytes (0 = no section prefix)
00341         WORD section;           // Section prefix value
00342         DWORD displacement;     // Displacement value
00343         DWORD immediate;        // Immediate value
00344         int flags;              // Operand flags
00345 } OPERAND, *POPERAND;
00346 
00347 // struct INSTRUCTION is used to interface the library
00348 typedef struct _INSTRUCTION {
00349         int length;             // Instruction length
00350         enum Instruction type;  // Instruction type
00351         enum Mode mode;         // Addressing mode
00352         BYTE opcode;            // Actual opcode
00353         BYTE modrm;             // MODRM byte
00354         BYTE sib;               // SIB byte
00355         int modrm_offset;       // MODRM byte offset
00356         int extindex;           // Extension table index
00357         int fpuindex;           // FPU table index
00358         int dispbytes;          // Displacement bytes (0 = no displacement)
00359         int immbytes;           // Immediate bytes (0 = no immediate)
00360         int sectionbytes;       // Section prefix bytes (0 = no section prefix)
00361         OPERAND op1;            // First operand (if any)
00362         OPERAND op2;            // Second operand (if any)
00363         OPERAND op3;            // Additional operand (if any)
00364         PINST ptr;              // Pointer to instruction table
00365         int flags;              // Instruction flags
00366         short eflags_affected;  // Process eflags affected
00367         short eflags_used;      // Processor eflags used by this instruction
00368         int iop_written;        // mask of affected implied registers (written)
00369         int iop_read;           // mask of affected implied registers (read)
00370 } INSTRUCTION, *PINSTRUCTION;

00376         INSTRUCTION *inst,      // pointer to INSTRUCTION structure

00378         enum Mode mode          // mode: MODE_32 or MODE_16
00379 );
00380 
00381 // Get complete instruction string
00382 int get_instruction_string(
00383         INSTRUCTION *inst,      // pointer to INSTRUCTION structure
00384         enum Format format,     // instruction format: FORMAT_ATT or FORMAT_INTEL
00385         DWORD offset,           // instruction absolute address
00386         char *string,           // string buffer
00387         int length              // string length
00388 );
00389 
00390 // Get mnemonic string
00391 int get_mnemonic_string(
00392         INSTRUCTION *inst,      // pointer to INSTRUCTION structure
00393         enum Format format,     // instruction format: FORMAT_ATT or FORMAT_INTEL
00394         char *string,           // string buffer
00395         int length              // string length
00396 );
00397 
00398 // Get individual operand string
00399 int get_operand_string(
00400         INSTRUCTION *inst,      // pointer to INSTRUCTION structure
00401         POPERAND op,            // pointer to OPERAND structure
00402         enum Format format,     // instruction format: FORMAT_ATT or FORMAT_INTEL
00403         DWORD offset,           // instruction absolute address
00404         char *string,           // string buffer
00405         int length              // string length
00406 );

00444 // Instruction flags (prefixes)
00445 
00446 // Group 1
00447 #define MASK_PREFIX_G1(x) ((x) & 0xff000000) >> 24
00448 #define PREFIX_LOCK                     0x01000000      // 0xf0
00449 #define PREFIX_REPNE                    0x02000000      // 0xf2
00450 #define PREFIX_REP                      0x03000000      // 0xf3
00451 #define PREFIX_REPE                     0x03000000      // 0xf3
00452 // Group 2
00453 #define MASK_PREFIX_G2(x) ((x) & 0x00ff0000) >> 16
00454 #define PREFIX_ES_OVERRIDE              0x00010000      // 0x26
00455 #define PREFIX_CS_OVERRIDE              0x00020000      // 0x2e
00456 #define PREFIX_SS_OVERRIDE              0x00030000      // 0x36
00457 #define PREFIX_DS_OVERRIDE              0x00040000      // 0x3e
00458 #define PREFIX_FS_OVERRIDE              0x00050000      // 0x64
00459 #define PREFIX_GS_OVERRIDE              0x00060000      // 0x65
00460 // Group 3 & 4
00461 #define MASK_PREFIX_G3(x)        ((x) & 0x0000ff00) >> 8
00462 #define MASK_PREFIX_OPERAND(x)   ((x) & 0x00000f00) >> 8
00463 #define MASK_PREFIX_ADDR(x)      ((x) & 0x0000f000) >> 12
00464 #define PREFIX_OPERAND_SIZE_OVERRIDE    0x00000100      // 0x66
00465 #define PREFIX_ADDR_SIZE_OVERRIDE       0x00001000      // 0x67
00466 
00467 // Extensions
00468 
00469 #define MASK_EXT(x) ((x) & 0x000000ff)
00470 #define EXT_G1_1        0x00000001
00471 #define EXT_G1_2        0x00000002
00472 #define EXT_G1_3        0x00000003
00473 #define EXT_G2_1        0x00000004
00474 #define EXT_G2_2        0x00000005
00475 #define EXT_G2_3        0x00000006
00476 #define EXT_G2_4        0x00000007
00477 #define EXT_G2_5        0x00000008
00478 #define EXT_G2_6        0x00000009
00479 #define EXT_G3_1        0x0000000a
00480 #define EXT_G3_2        0x0000000b
00481 #define EXT_G4          0x0000000c
00482 #define EXT_G5          0x0000000d
00483 #define EXT_G6          0x0000000e
00484 #define EXT_G7          0x0000000f
00485 #define EXT_G8          0x00000010
00486 #define EXT_G9          0x00000011
00487 #define EXT_GA          0x00000012
00488 #define EXT_GB          0x00000013
00489 #define EXT_GC          0x00000014
00490 #define EXT_GD          0x00000015
00491 #define EXT_GE          0x00000016
00492 #define EXT_GF          0x00000017
00493 #define EXT_G0          0x00000018
00494 
00495 // Extra groups for 2 and 3-byte opcodes, and FPU stuff
00496 #define EXT_T2          0x00000020      // opcode table 2
00497 #define EXT_CP          0x00000030      // co-processor
00498 
00499 // Instruction type flags
00500 
00501 #define TYPE_3          0x80000000
00502 #define MASK_TYPE_FLAGS(x) ((x) & 0xff000000)
00503 #define MASK_TYPE_VALUE(x) ((x) & 0x00ffffff)
00504 
00505 
00506 // Operand flags
00507 
00508 #define FLAGS_NONE 0
00509 
00510 // Operand Addressing Methods, from the Intel manual
00511 #define MASK_AM(x) ((x) & 0x00ff0000)
00512 #define AM_A 0x00010000         // Direct address with segment prefix
00513 #define AM_C 0x00020000         // MODRM reg field defines control register
00514 #define AM_D 0x00030000         // MODRM reg field defines debug register
00515 #define AM_E 0x00040000         // MODRM byte defines reg/memory address
00516 #define AM_G 0x00050000         // MODRM byte defines general-purpose reg
00517 #define AM_I 0x00060000         // Immediate data follows
00518 #define AM_J 0x00070000         // Immediate value is relative to EIP
00519 #define AM_M 0x00080000         // MODRM mod field can refer only to memory
00520 #define AM_O 0x00090000         // Displacement follows (without modrm/sib)
00521 #define AM_P 0x000a0000         // MODRM reg field defines MMX register
00522 #define AM_Q 0x000b0000         // MODRM defines MMX register or memory 
00523 #define AM_R 0x000c0000         // MODRM mod field can only refer to register
00524 #define AM_S 0x000d0000         // MODRM reg field defines segment register
00525 #define AM_T 0x000e0000         // MODRM reg field defines test register
00526 #define AM_V 0x000f0000         // MODRM reg field defines XMM register
00527 #define AM_W 0x00100000         // MODRM defines XMM register or memory 
00528 // Extra addressing modes used in this implementation
00529 #define AM_I1  0x00200000       // Immediate byte 1 encoded in instruction
00530 #define AM_REG 0x00210000       // Register encoded in instruction
00531 #define AM_IND 0x00220000       // Register indirect encoded in instruction
00532 
00533 // Operand Types, from the intel manual
00534 #define MASK_OT(x) ((x) & 0xff000000)
00535 #define OT_a  0x01000000
00536 #define OT_b  0x02000000        // always 1 byte
00537 #define OT_c  0x03000000        // byte or word, depending on operand
00538 #define OT_d  0x04000000        // double-word
00539 #define OT_q  0x05000000        // quad-word
00540 #define OT_dq 0x06000000        // double quad-word
00541 #define OT_v  0x07000000        // word or double-word, depending on operand
00542 #define OT_w  0x08000000        // always word
00543 #define OT_p  0x09000000        // 32-bit or 48-bit pointer
00544 #define OT_pi 0x0a000000        // quadword MMX register
00545 #define OT_pd 0x0b000000        // 128-bit double-precision float
00546 #define OT_ps 0x0c000000        // 128-bit single-precision float
00547 #define OT_s  0x0d000000        // 6-byte pseudo descriptor
00548 #define OT_sd 0x0e000000        // Scalar of 128-bit double-precision float
00549 #define OT_ss 0x0f000000        // Scalar of 128-bit single-precision float
00550 #define OT_si 0x10000000        // Doubleword integer register
00551 #define OT_t  0x11000000        // 80-bit packed FP data
00552 
00553 // Operand permissions
00554 #define MASK_PERMS(x) ((x) & 0x0000f000)
00555 #define P_r   0x00004000        // Read
00556 #define P_w   0x00002000        // Write
00557 #define P_x   0x00001000        // Execute
00558 
00559 // Additional operand flags
00560 #define MASK_FLAGS(x) ((x) & 0x00000f00)
00561 #define F_s   0x00000100        // sign-extend 1-byte immediate
00562 #define F_r   0x00000200        // use segment register
00563 #define F_f   0x00000400        // use FPU register
00564 
00565 // Mask 0x000000f0 unused atm
00566 
00567 // Operand register mask
00568 #define MASK_REG(x) ((x) & 0x0000000f)

00572 // MODRM byte
00573 #define MASK_MODRM_MOD(x) (((x) & 0xc0) >> 6)
00574 #define MASK_MODRM_REG(x) (((x) & 0x38) >> 3)
00575 #define MASK_MODRM_RM(x)   ((x) & 0x7)

00577 // SIB byte
00578 #define MASK_SIB_SCALE(x) MASK_MODRM_MOD(x)
00579 #define MASK_SIB_INDEX(x) MASK_MODRM_REG(x)
00580 #define MASK_SIB_BASE(x)  MASK_MODRM_RM(x)
